reviews.review_msg: Show up to class to get easy participation marks. Lectures were heavy but still interesting as it gets you thinking about your everyday life. No textbook just lecture material for exams. Lectures can be kind of long sometimes. Overall an interesting class and she's very open to questions and discussions.
Very nice lady, cares about student's questions and concerns, Study a lot for your exams, interesting lectures, The midterm took 20 minutes on average,however make sure you know your material well!
I agree: very disorganized and confusing. Not so helpful as some said.
Avoid her. Inconsistent, unhelpful, confusing, and very disorganized.

Not a gpa boost. She is unclear a lot but if you need help she will assist. Straight up don't take this unless you have an interest in easc. A final worth 50% of your grade and 70 long answer questions is too much for an intro course

She can be very confusing with inconsistent information. VERY unorganized - for example one mid term had a bunch of duplicate questions which she hadn't noticed until we were writing it and we didn't get the syllabus until 4 weeks into the semester. Final exam is worth 50% and is supposed to be cumulative - but majority was from only 1 topic.

I did well on both midterms, but I wouldn't call it a GPA booster, per se. You have to put in the work and it can be VERY dry and boring material if you're not extremely interested in EASC. Final is cumulative and covers a LOT of info. She often rushes at the end of class to squeeze as much info in as possible & often even goes 5 mins or so over.

EASC 107 with Francesca is a good GPA booster. No papers/assignments, only midterms and a final. Exams are based almost completely off of lecture notes which she posts online. She does have an accent and is a little hard to understand at first, but you get used to it pretty quickly. Francesca is very approachable and offers help whenever asked.

Super reasonable and down to Earth prof. Lots of material, but the exams are open book. If it were closed book, the difficulty would be a 4-5 because there is a lot of material; however, open-book, an A in the course is extremely realistic. He is very open to feedback and makes an effort to better your academic experience. Great guy to talk to
As a part time earth science teacher at SFU, Orlando explains things well, is passionate and likes his students. His tests are straightforward and can easily be passed with some effort.

Orlando is a great prof who marks fairly and does a decent job with lectures. Grading scheme is fair and tests are pretty straightforward. I am not sure he adjusted his tests for the change to online but since the class is not curved this made the exams pretty easy in my opinion. Homework was weekly and didn't take a lot of time. Overall, great.
